entry.title: Slack
entry.content:
Slack: Getting Past Burnout, Busywork and the Myth of Total Efficiency by Tom DeMarco

Surround your pullquote like this {" text to be quoted "}

Slack is essential for adapting to change. “The more highly adapted an organism becomes, the less adaptable it is to any new change.”

Knowledge work – non fungible – high cost of task switching

Importance of failure – a culture of learning – without fear of making mistakes – “Risk avoidance is flight from opportunity”

“Slack is the natural enemy of efficiency, and efficiency is the natural enemy of slack.”

fungible: being of such nature or kind as to be freely exchangeable or replaceable, in whole or in part, for another of like nature or kind

“immersion time is required to overcome a kind of metal inertia”

“People under time pressure don’t think faster”

“shouldn’t do any kind of error-prone work late in a work session, because they know their thinking is no longer sufficiently clear for that kind of task”

“The safety that is required for essential change is a sure sense that no one will be mocked, demeaned, or belittled while struggling to achieve renewed mastery.”

“the essense of the training experience is this slowing down (Learning takes time.)”

“We grew up in an age where stasis was a possibility and a desired state. Change was something you went through to reach a new and better stasis.”
